decks.notes: The main strategy of this BUG Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using cards like Thoughtseize and Daze to go after their key cards, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Murderous Cut. The deck also aims to generate card advantage through cards like Rakshasa's Bargain and Brainstorm, while utilizing counterspells like Spell Pierce and Force of Will to protect its key threats like Murktide Regent. The mana base is built to provide a stable mana base for casting the diverse range of spells in the deck.

The primary strategy of this Legacy Aggro - Burn deck is to deal damage quickly and efficiently through low-cost burn spells and aggressive creatures. The deck focuses on playing cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel, Monastery Swiftspear, and Goblin Guide to chip away at the opponent's life total while maximizing the damage output with cards like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Fireblast. Price of Progress is used to punish opponents with non-basic lands, while Roiling Vortex helps to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with consistent damage and finish them off before they can stabilize.

The deck is focused on quickly assembling the Cephalid Breakfast combo by using cards like Nomads en-Kor and Cephalid Illusionist to mill the library and win the game with Thassa's Oracle. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo, along with card selection spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to find key pieces. Urza's Saga is included to tutor for important artifacts like Shuko. The deck aims to win the game in a few quick turns by assembling its combo efficiently.

The main focus of this Merfolk aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of powerful Merfolk creatures, supported by disruptive abilities like Tide Shaper and Vodalian Hexcatcher. Using Aether Vial and Force of Will to control the board and protect your creatures, the deck aims to establish early dominance and keep the pressure on with efficient tempo plays. The inclusion of True-Name Nemesis provides a difficult-to-answer threat, while cards like Daze and Wasteland allow for disruption of the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with creature cards such as Narcomoeba and Poxwalkers, then using cards like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to mill through the deck until Thassa's Oracle can be played to win the game by having no cards in the library. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Pact of Negation to protect the combo, along with graveyard recursion options like Reanimate and Dread Return to further advance the game plan. The goal is to assemble the combo and win as fast as possible.

The deck focuses on using Paradigm Shift to quickly mill your library and then win the game by having Thassa's Oracle as your only remaining card in library. Aether Vial helps cheat creatures into play, while Force of Will and Brainstorm provide protection and card selection. The deck also includes various creatures and spells to control the board and disrupt your opponent's strategy. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and efficiently, while using counterspells and disruptive elements to stay ahead in the game.
